title: Bureaucracy As Active Ingredient
summary:
Key ideas
- Sometimes bureaucracies create policies that are active in their plans
- Insurance companies are required to provide a new $10,000 medication to those who really need it
- Doctors have no incentive to say "No" to their patients
- The insurance company adding a cost makes it harder for doctors to check "Yes" always
- Organizations have a legal incentive not to deny people things
- They have an economic incentive not to say Yes to all requests they get

Key learnings
- An elegant way of separating out the needy from the greedy if every other option is closed to you.
- Organizations have a legal incentive not to deny people things but they have an economic incentive not to say yes to every request they get.

Key questions
- Does this explanation fit with evidence?
- Does this sort of thing explain rituals like doctor’s notes for back pain or ADHD diagnoses for stimulants?
- Is it a factor that disincentivizes existing bureaucracies from getting better?
